# Unchained
[![ShapeShift](https://img.shields.io/badge/ShapeShift%20DAO-Unchained-386ff9?logo=data:image/svg+xml;base64,)](https://shapeshift.com) [![ShapeShift](https://img.shields.io/badge/License-MIT-brightgreen)](https://github.com/CroixDrinkers/unchained/blob/master/LICENSE) [![ShapeShift](https://img.shields.io/badge/PRs-welcome-brightgreen)](https://github.com/CroixDrinkers/unchained/pulls)



A blockchain abstraction project containing coin stacks that function as the backbone to any blockchain services.

## Helpful Docs
- [Pulumi](https://www.pulumi.com/docs/)
- [Kubernetes](https://kubernetes.io/docs/home/)
- [OpenAPI](https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification)
- [TSOA](https://tsoa-community.github.io/docs/)

## Project Structure
- `packages` - shared packages across various coinstacks
- `coinstacks/common` - common coinstack logic to reduce duplication
- `coinstacks/{coin}` - coin specific logic
- `**/pulumi` - pulumi infrastructure code for project deployment

## Coin Stack
- Blockchain node: A dedicated node per indexer and eventually a publicly accessible node cluster (currently cointainers)
- Indexer: Either a suitable third party service such as blockbook, or a hand rolled service if none are available
- [Ingester](docs/ingester.md): A rabbitmq topology to receive pending transaction and newly confirmed blocks via websocket/zmq from a node.
- Common API: A REST API that provides necessary data to a client in a common format across all blockchains

![Coin Stack Architecture](docs/coinstack.png)

## Initial Setup
- Use correct node version with [Node Version Manager](https://github.com/nvm-sh/nvm#installing-and-updating):
  ```
  nvm use
  ```
- Install dependencies and build:
  ```
  yarn && yarn build
  ```
- Make copies of the required env files
  ```
  cp sample.env .env
  cp sample.env.secrets .env.secrets
  ```
- Fill out any empty secrets with your own credentials in `.env.secrets`
- Point to the correct nodes and indexers for the coinstack you wish to run in `.env`

## Ports
- API: `31300`
- MongoDB: `27017`
- RabbitMQ: `30672`
- RabbitMQ Admin: `31672`


## Docker-Compose Local Dev Instructions
---
_Lightweight local development environment_
#### **Prerequisites**
  - Install [docker-compose](https://docs.docker.com/compose/install/)

#### **Running**
  - From root unchained directory
  ```
  yarn dev:{coinstack_name}
  ```

## Kubernetes Local Dev Instructions
---
_Mirrors production kubernetes environment as closely as possible_
### Docker Desktop (macOS):
#### **Prerequisites**
  - Install [Helm](https://helm.sh/docs/intro/install/) and add the Mongo Helm chart
    ```
    brew install helm
    ```
    ```
    helm repo add bitnami https://charts.bitnami.com/bitnami
    ```

  - Go into [Docker Desktop](https://www.docker.com/products/docker-desktop) preferences and enable Kubernetes
  - Create a [pulumi](https://app.pulumi.com/) account
  - Install the pulumi CLI:
    ```
    brew install pulumi
    ```
  - Log into your pulumi account:
    ```
    pulumi login
    ```

#### **Common Infra**
Initialize a pulumi stack in `unchained/pulumi`:  
```
pulumi stack init docker-desktop
```
Deploy common pulumi infrastructure
```
pulumi up
```

#### **Coinstack Infra**
Initialize a pulumi stack in the coinstack you wish to run (ex. `unchained/coinstacks/ethereum/pulumi`):
```
pulumi stack init docker-desktop
```
Deploy coinstack:
```
pulumi up
```

#### **Useful Commands**
View and select correct pulumi stack (pulumi dir):
```
pulumi stack ls
pulumi stack select minikube
```
Delete currently running kubernetes resources and remove from pulumi stack state (pulumi dir):
```
pulumi destroy
```
View localhost service port mappings:
```
kubectl get svc --all-namespaces
```
If you ever need/want a fresh cluster:  
  - Go into Docker Desktop Dashboard  
  - Click the :beetle: button (Troubleshoot)
  - Click "Reset Kubernetes cluster" to delete all stacks and Kubernetes resources
  - Destroy pulumi stack state where resources were deployed (pulumi dir):
    ```
    pulumi destroy
    ```

If enabling Kubernetes is hanging in docker desktop (starting can take 5+ min, so wait a little before trying):
  - Go into Docker Desktop Dashboard
  - Click the :beetle: button (Troubleshoot)
  - Click Clean / Purge data

### Minikube (Linux):
#### **Prerequisites**
  - Install [minikube](https://minikube.sigs.k8s.io/docs/start/)
  - Create a [pulumi](https://app.pulumi.com/) account
  - Install the pulumi CLI:
    ```
    curl -fsSL https://get.pulumi.com | sh
    ```
  - Log into your pulumi account:
    ```
    pulumi login
    ```
  - Start minikube and mount home directory to provide hot reloading:
    ```
    minikube start --mount-string="$HOME/{path_to_unchained}:$HOME/{path_to_unchained} --mount"
    ```
  - If you are pointing at any local docker images you will need to set the local docker environment to minikube first before building the image
    ```
    eval $(minikube docker-env)
    ```
  - Install [helm](https://helm.sh/docs/intro/install/)
  - Add mongo helm chart
    ```
    helm repo add bitnami https://charts.bitnami.com/bitnami
    ```

#### **Common Infra**
Initialize a pulumi stack in `unchained/pulumi`:  
```
pulumi stack init minikube
```
Deploy common pulumi infrastructure
```
pulumi up
```

#### **Coinstack Infra**
Initialize a pulumi stack in the coinstack you wish to run (ex. `unchained/coinstacks/ethereum/pulumi`):
```
pulumi stack init minikube
```
Deploy coinstack:
```
pulumi up
```

#### **Useful Commands**
View and select correct pulumi stack (pulumi dir):
```
pulumi stack ls
pulumi stack select minikube
```
Delete currently running kubernetes resources and remove from pulumi stack state (pulumi dir):
```
pulumi destroy
```
View service endpoints created by minikube:
```
minikube service list
```
Metrics can be turned on with:
```
minikube addons enable metrics-server
```
You can stop minikube when you are not using it:
```
minikube stop
```
If you ever need/want a fresh cluster:  
  - Delete cluster:
    ```
    minikube delete
    ```
  - Destroy pulumi stack state where resources were deployed (pulumi dir):
    ```
    pulumi destroy (where applicable)
    ```
